modules.description: Provides pretty-printing for network-related errors using a custom format function. Works with the `error` type, which represents various network failure conditions. Used to generate human-readable error messages in network communication logs.

Tracks packet reception and transmission sizes, maintaining cumulative counts and totals. Operates on a mutable state structure that stores packet size data. Used to monitor network activity by logging incoming and outgoing packet lengths in real time.

Provides network interface operations such as sending and receiving packets, configuring IP addresses, and managing socket connections. Works with packet buffers, IP addresses, and socket descriptors. Used to implement network protocols, handle raw packet transmission, and establish communication layers in unikernel applications.

Provides functions to write and listen for Ethernet frames, manage network device disconnection, and retrieve MAC address and MTU. Operates on Cstruct.t buffers and tracks interface statistics. Used for sending raw packets, receiving network traffic, and monitoring interface performance.
